DOC.brief_title: Standard Medication Reconciliation Protocol Primary Care Office-based Setting
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize clinical trial implementation initial effectiveness two intervention improve medication reconciliation primary care office . The intervention test 1 ) patient review printed paper copy EMR medication list prior see physician 2 ) medical assistant begin interview open-ended question . We test follow two hypothesis : 1 . Providing patient paper copy EMR medication list upon check-in , review accuracy prior office visit , improve agreement EMR medication list patient report phone interview within one week office visit . 2 . The medical assistant practice routinely use open-ended question introduce medication review improve agreement EMR medication list patient report phone interview within one week office visit . The main outcome measure study full agreement prescription medication medication list electronic medical record conclusion patient 's office visit list generate pharmacist phone interview perform within week office visit . The study take place 2-4 Cleveland Clinic Health Centers primary care office . A sample size 400 patient enrol : 20 pair physicians medical assistant invite volunteer study , 20 patient per MD/MA pair recruit . Medical assistant train use script open-ended question begin review medication patient . The study coordinator implement print list intervention provide paper list patient . Consenting patient randomize one four group ( A-D ) : A : NO patient review print medication list & NO open-ended question B : Patient review print medication list ONLY C : Open-ended question ONLY D : BOTH patient review print medication list & open-ended question To document medication patient report take , pharmacist conduct detail phone interview patient and/or caretaker within week office visit use prepared script . The pharmacist note discrepancy EMR patient's/caretaker 's self report . In order consider full agreement , medication list patient report must agree five follow element : 1 ) name , 2 ) dose , 3 ) frequency , 4 ) route , 5 ) PRN status . Our goal statistically test whether proportion medication list agreement patient report differs intervention group compare non-intervention group . First , unadjusted analysis utilize difference proportion test linear contrast describe planned comparison . Then , multivariable mixed model use determine significance intervention adjustment . If intervention successful , incorporated standard medication reconciliation protocol Cleveland Clinic primary care office practice . If highly successful , protocol could serve new standard medication reconciliation outpatient primary care practice United States .
